moves.1. e4: my usual please landlord....E4 it's what i know and love.
moves.1... c6: I don't like this move for him i mean it stops Nc6 i like Nc6...
moves.3. d3 dxe4: you know whats coming....A typical trade off..
moves.4. Nxe4 Bf5: Hmmm, is he gonna exchange off pieces this early? i sometimes get uncomfortable with trading off this early i wonder if the opponent just likes to take rather than think..generally speaking.
moves.5. Qf3: take me or i take you, or run.....plus i develop a little more. I don't know if this was my best option i could just leave the knight and carry on as normal maybe Be2 or something
moves.5... e6: Or get back up, of course theres no way back for that bishop now, he's committed to the cause..
moves.6. Ng3: I quite fancy that bishop now pawn aswel! thats if i get a chance..
moves.7... Bd6 8. Nh3: can't remember why i did this but it looks good, right? I think i saw this in a book and decided to give it a go....
moves.8... Nd7 9. Ng5: Just a push really...maybe i was better off with Ne4 with ideas of Nd6 ..
moves.9... Ngf6: clearing the way....Still don't know why i havn't gone to Ne4...
moves.10. h3: Just in case, it's like a nervous tic i have on the chess board.....
moves.10... Ne5: Alert!! Queen threatened....And some major advancement on his part, i'm getting claustrophobic in here..
moves.11. Qd1: Back to safety....for a little while..
moves.12... Ned7 13. Ng3e4: Trying to exchange off a few bits just to clear the congestion..Too late me thinks..
moves.14. Nxd6+: I like bishops, yum yum...plus i felt i needed to relieve some of the pressure i was feeling..
moves.15. Be2: had to protect that little beauty...And i had to clear the way for a quick castle should the need arise..
moves.15... h6: if only that bishop wasn't there Bg6..I'de love to go Nf7 right now..
moves.16. Nf3: So back i go.....i hate going back if it's out of sheer self preservation but i had to really..
moves.16... b6 17. Qa4: That back door again? Probably not. i'm hoping for a miracle i'm rubbing that lamp real hard but no genie is appearing..
moves.18... Nc5: This is a double edged threat look at the eye's on d3, that's gotta be his entry point...
moves.19. Qc2: So i try to block that entrance..
moves.19... Nd5: I'm not liking this knight advance, we're all level material wise so i'm happy to exchange off a few pieces but i'de rather not right now because positionally i think he would be better off, lets see what happens...
moves.20. Bd4: A rook for your trouble sir? again more wishful thinking...
moves.21... Nd7: No.....I feel at this point had i made the right move i may have caused a bit of trouble here...
moves.22. g3: To stop Nf4 and the threat to my bishop...and to stop him eyeing d3 aswel...
moves.22... e5: Erk!...too late to cause an irritation on the queen side now..
moves.23... Rhf8: He's starting to coordinate his forces i need a reply with menace...and plenty of it..
moves.25. Bd2: So i move further away this looks weak but i have my reasons...
moves.26. c4: I'm starting to like this pawn thing i got goin on here....
moves.26... Nd5f6: Bye bye...It's about time he did a bit of the retreating..
moves.27. b5: I had so many options here but i chose to keep the pawn advance going simply to keep pressure on his king....on reflection this was the wrong move maybe Qa4 would have been better...
moves.27... cxb5: Good i like a king who's pawn guard is shattered...But not completely ruined sadly...
moves.28... Nc5: Ah....I got blocked there well and truely....
moves.29. cxb5: I'll have to make do with a pawn...
moves.29... Qd5 30. Nh2: I didn't want to lose 2 pieces for the price of 1...
moves.30... e4: Things are getting sticky here he's all over me with more potential movement and better lines, i could be in trouble...
moves.31. d4: i just couldn't allow e4xd3 threatening both queen and bishop so a pawn sacrifice is the order of the day...
moves.31... Nb3: This is a nightmare i gotta keep dodging bullets and i aint bullet proof!
moves.32... Nxd4: see what i mean about running and bullets?
moves.33... Bxe2: this was innevitable what to do now, by this time i got tag in my ear boasting and pontificating...
moves.34... Bxb5: i'm really getting it from tag now, i hope my plan works....
moves.35. Rc7+: Suprise!! A rook sacrifice, something needed to be done i hope this works...
moves.35... Kxc7: A little respite but i can see this turning into a bloodbath...
moves.36. Qxa7+ Qb7: He's got all bases covered and i have no answers...
moves.38... Kxb7 39. Ra1: I'm just waiting to be put out of my misery now, i've resorted to pawn pushing... pawn pushing.....
moves.39... Nxb4: He's doing what i would do, trade off material, he has it to burn, i don't!!
moves.42. f3: Here we go more pawn pushing, just deal with me tag and do it now!
moves.43. Rxd1: again forced play, but the last thing i want to do...
moves.44. Kg2: I'm in a corner and wondering where it went wrong....
moves.45... Nh5: here comes sir kill me off..
moves.46. Nf1: what the hell, i've lost the will to live now, i want it over and quick...
moves.47. Kxf1 Nxg3+ 48. Ke1 Ra2 49. fxe4: Pawn pushing again, it's all i have left...
moves.49... Kc6 50. b5+ Kc5 51. e5 Kd5 52. e6: I say i'm happy to resign now, please spare me....
moves.53... Kd5: This is getting emmbarresing i really should resign but i want to give tag the pleasure of saying checkmate so i plod on..
moves.54. Kc1 Kc4 55. Kb1 Kb3 56. h4 f4 57. Kc: And there we have it, still havn't worked out what went wrong, i'll work it out though. Cheers, good game.
